attributes.action: Sainsbury's: Reconsider your decision to close Netto's UK stores
attributes.additional_details: The chain employs 400 people and its brightly coloured supermarkets have brought new life to moribund or disused store units across the North of England.  The stores are best known for their discount range of produce, fresh fruit, bakery including a range of Danish pastries, and discount booze, as well as the colourful weekly magazine that they put through our letterboxes, and stunts involving it's giant Lego dog logo.
attributes.background: On 4 July 2016 Sainsbury's decided to close its 16 Netto stores in the North of England by the end of August.  The stores are a joint venture with Dansk Supermarked Group of Denmark, who own the Netto name.
